item.title: Windows 7 64-bit runserver
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

Lol… Your batch file would’ve been endlessly looping itself. So despite the fact that your .batch file was wrong for a 64bit system, it wouldn’t have worked anyways because it just kept looping.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 64-bit runserver
item.dc:creator: @lover854 lover854
item.description:
@lover854 wrote:

Use code taggs next time but why is there start Run-Server.bat in your run.bat for server?

try this

@echo off title Project Insanity java -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar;-server -XX:+AggressiveHeap -XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+RelaxAccessControlCheck -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:CompileThreshold=1 -XX:ThreadStackSize=128 server.Server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 64-bit runserver
item.dc:creator: @waydownabove waydownabove
item.description:
@waydownabove wrote:

i recently moved from xp to win 7 and runserver.bat wont work anymore. i have java. this is my runserver code:

@echo off
title Project Insanity
java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
start Run-Server.bat
exit

and this is my client code that works fine

@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

Read full topic
